title.narrative: OTP 6: CHILD RIGHTS MONITORING

description.narrative: By 2017, central and local authorities have improved capacity to monitor and promote child rights, and to design and implement evidence-based policies and budgetary frameworks., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Corporate External Relations And Partnerships, Communication And Resource Mobilization, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, governance structures and social attitudes are more child-sensitive and equity oriented.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, central and local authorities have improved capacity to monitor and promote child rights, and to design and implementevidence-based policies and budgetary frameworks.

description.narrative: In 2017 UNICEF provided continuous support to the Ombudsperson for Child Rights, the National Bureau of Statistics and other stakeholders and enhanced their capacity to monitoring child rights, provide quality contribution to treaty body periodic reviews (CRC, CER and CRPD) and ensure availability of child rights related disaggregated data. | Status:Met | As-of Date:12/01/2018

title.narrative: Percentage of schools that apply adjusted to inclusive education per-capita funding formula (adjusted formula to be piloted in 2014)
Number of entities submitting alternative reports to international review bodies (UPR, CRC, CEDO, CRPD) provided by NGOs with active children
Number of of policy documents developed with the participation/consultation of children and NGOs representing vulnerable groups
Key disaggregated data is available to monitor the situation of women and children in Transnistria through MICS- MoRES Level1 exercise.

baseline.value: Data is not available, MICS process initiated

title.narrative: Capacity of the Ombudsman

baseline.value: No Ombudsman for Child Rights in Place

target.value: 2017:Ombudsman for Child Rights in place and is capable to monitor and support protection of the rights of the most vulnerable children

actual.value: 2017:Ombudsman for Child Rights in place and is capable to monitor and support protection of the rights of the most vulnerable children

title.narrative: Number of key Government policies, strategies and action plans developed with UNICEF support (Strategy on Family and Child Protection, Action Plans on Inclusive Education and Out of school children) with functioning monitoring framework , focused on the most disadvantaged children and incorporate relevant MoRES indicators
Number of advocacy initiatives on public finance for children
